content:
Hello there

Refreshing msf.files in the profile map can be useful before deleting the complete program . Close Thunderbird and go to your profile map. Delete or rename all these msf.files and also that json.files in that profile map there and restart the program again then to see there if the problem is gone and retained now.


Strong software that can interrupt thunderbird of having some normal process on that desktop screen of normally closing the program can be that problem there , software tools like cc cleaner or others can be those bully s so delete them for a while . You can use the profile manager to create that new profile if is needed there close thunderbird and open that profile manager it and click on create new profile there. To getting to the profile manager

Open windows go to the search option for system. Or press that window logo together with the letter r. Type thunderbird.exe -p

If that profile works correctly you can transfer that data into that profile now.


Greetings googlethunderbird.

content: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile and the prefs.js is in that folder. If you do NOT have Explorer set to show suffixes, it will appear as just prefs.

content: To locate your profile : click on Help and then click on Troubleshooting Information, scroll down a bit and you'll see Profile folder ( on the left side - Blue column ), on the right column you'll see Open Folder in bold, click on it .
creator: MichelT

content:
Hi

Annette said
Can I get there from Explorer?

Hi Annette. You can get there with File Exlorer. Or just use Help > Troubleshooting information > Profile folder > Show ...

Then look in that profile folder for the prefs.js file that Michel mentioned.

The concern was about the presence of anti-virus software, not the presence of a virus. A common trouble-shooting step in these situations is to start Windows in safe mode with networking, start Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode (help menu), and see if the problem still occurs. That will tell you if your anti-virus software or something else is interering with Thunderbird.

content:
rhodelta said
I get emails from a certain party which includes a corporate animated gif which I estimate adds 1.6MB to each email. Can I block this gif without blocking the email.

That would depend.

If the gif is embedded in the email. Then no. If the Gif is a remote image downloaded from a website you can block the website domain in your router and never see it again. You could also simply block remote images in Thunderbird and never see any remote images unless you specifically allow them for that sender or domain.

content:
Se stai usando IMAP come protocollo, allora i messaggi sono stati cancellati perché questo protocollo prevede la costante sincronizzazione tra Thunderbird ed il server. Se invece avessi usato POP3 la copia su Thunderbird sarebbe stata indipendente dal server.

Se può tentare di recuperare qualcosa ma dipende dalla situazione. - Hai un backup recente? - In alternativa puoi tentare di recuperare la posta dagli archivi di Thunderbird sperando che non siano ancora stati sovrascritti. In questi appunti viene spiegato in linea generale come procedere -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Importare+mbox.-

content:
What is the problem with entering Sterrence in there and removing it later. (this is a public forum and your Sterrence name is attached to 54 support topics. It is not as if the name goes anywhere but into the display name field in the default identity for the account. I tried entering a single tap on the space bar. The application was happy to proceed. No mail is sent in the setup process so no one but you is ever going to see it.

So I think your constraint of leaving it blank is really not an issue except that you would like to do that.

The only time the name information is used is to form part of the display name in the default identity which is used to send mail for that email address. As no mail is sent in the setup process, any old random collection of characters will make the program happy and you can correct it to whatever you like later, including a blank space.

content:
Follow these steps in detail and you should have no problems. Be sure to install thunderbird from thunderbird.net.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
Seems you have several mail accounts.

I can see a load of 'popstate-n.dat' folders which are in an account part of which is shown in image. There is clearly an issue with the download for that account as those files should not be visible. Looks like the download record store file has been corrupted. But that's another issue.

re :This account actually has a "draft" folder, unlike most of my other accounts in Thunderbird, which I also cannot figure out and no one has helped me with.

I checked your Profile and this is the only question you have asked - so not sure what you mean by 'no one as helped me with'. I cannot see a question asking about it.

I'm assuming all those accounts are Pop mail accounts.

General Info: In Pop accounts, folders get created when you use them. They get created in the account as used in the 'From' email address of email being composed. So, a 'Drafts' folder will appear when you are creating an email and choose to save as draft and a 'Sent' folder appears when you send from the account. If you have used an email address just to receive mail, but have never sent an email using that email address then the Pop account will not have those folders.

This is unusual..... In 'Local Folders' account: There is a folder which says Drafts on an account and also two Sent folders for different accounts. This is a bit odd so I'm wondering if at some point you tried to set your pop accounts as deferred accounts using a Global Inbox. Or whether you have got the 'Account SEttings' > Copies & Folders' for the account incorrectly set up.

You have two accounts with a very similar name Kay@ and Kei@ and identical part after the @. The one with 'Kay@' has an Inbox with 12267 emails - that's alot of emails to keep in one simple text document - that's a separate topic which maybe advise on later. But I notice there is a 'drafts - kay@etc' folder in 'Local Folders' Lets check this first:

For the 'Kay@email address' account

  • Account SEttings > Server Settings
  • Click on 'Advanced' button located on the right side
  • Please make sure this set up to say 'Inbox for this account'
  • click on 'OK'
  • Select 'Copies & Folders '

Check you have correct settings

  • Select 'Place a copy in'
  • Select 'Sent folder on' and choose correct account name 'Kay@correctdomain'

Now check Archives,

  • Select 'Keep message archives in'
  • Select 'Archives folder on' and choose correct account name 'Kay@correctdomain'

Drafts and Templates

  • Select 'Drafts folder on' and choose correct account name 'Kay@correctdomain'
  • Select 'Templates folder on' and choose correct account name 'Kay@correctdomain'

Then start to create a new message using From as the 'Kay@email address Just enter subject as Test and put some random text in compise then click on 'Save as Draft'

Does a Draft folder appear in that Kay@ account? Does it contain the draft test message ?

re: the email you were composing which you say does not appear in the expected drafts folder Is it possible you were actualy composing using the wrong From email address ? Look in Local Folders and select the 'Drafts -Kay@accountname' folder Is that draft saved in this location ?

content:
This error code, and the URL referencing login.xfinity.com, indicates that the issue is with your SMTP server settings and how it's attempting to authenticate your account.

Open Thunderbird's Account Settings: Go to Tools > Account Settings.

Select Your Email Account Xfinity, Gmail, or AT&T that is having the issue.

Find the SMTP Server Settings.

Edit the Server for the account you're working on (e.g., smtp.comcast.net for Xfinity) and click the Edit button.

Verify Authentication and Port Settings Check the correct port number for your SMTP server. 

       Xfinity: 587, Gmail: 465 or 587, AT&T: 465

Connection security should be set to SSL/TLS or STARTTLS

Authentication method should be set to Normal password or OAuth2

The user name for the SMTP server is usually your full email address

After making these changes, click OK to save. try sending a test email from the account again.
creator: norhorn

content:
For Xfinity, assuming you have already enabled access by 3rd-party apps like TB, check your outgoing settings:

smtp.comcast.net, 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/update-your-xfinity-email-settings

For AT&T, you must use a secure mail key in place of the account password.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/

Gmail should be straightforward, with the automatic settings.

If you've done all this, run Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps like AV, VPN etc. that might be blocking sending.

You do not need to copy or paste. you can type it in. the copy/paste dance is this: - highlight the text to copy - press cntl and 'c' - locate the place to paste it and press cntl and 'v'

Go to tools>Developer tools>error console - enter this text 

   openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")

This process erases all passwords.
